remarks: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus, part two.  If ` F ` is a function continuous on ` [ A , B ] ` and continuously differentiable on ` ( A , B ) ` , then the integral of the derivative of ` F ` is equal to ` F ( B ) - F ( A ) ` .  This is part of Metamath 100 proof #15. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 2-Sep-2014.)
